name: Desi Lydic
monologue: It’s been one week since Donald Trump announced his bold plan to destroy the economy, and guess what? It’s working.

name: Desi Lydic
monologue: I’m not an economist, but it’s probably a bad sign when the chart itself looks like it jumped off the roof.

name: Desi Lydic
monologue: Look at that drop. Six Flags is gonna make a roller coaster of that. ‘Mom, I wanna ride the Dow Jones.’ ‘We can’t afford it!'

name: Desi Lydic
monologue: 104 percent tariffs? Okay, this is getting really serious. We’ll know exactly how serious once we ask China to do the math for us.

name: Desi Lydic
monologue: Trump is out of control right now. I’d say he’s like a bull in a china shop, but at 104 percent I can’t afford to say that.

name: Desi Lydic
monologue: Oooh, I have to pick between Elon Musk and Peter Navarro? This is like the trolley problem if the problem was that you only have one trolley. “ on the brewing feud between two of trump’s top advisers

name: Desi Lydic
monologue: Powerful counterpoint. Powerful. God, I hope Elon Musk never has to defend himself in court: ‘Ladies and gentlement of the jury, Gaaayyyyy!'

name: Stephen Colbert
monologue: What? I need my Nintendo. What am I supposed to do without a new Mario game? Take a bunch of mushrooms and jump on turtles in real life? That’s what got me banned from the petting zoo.

name: Stephen Colbert
monologue: You can’t say it’s temporary and it’s permanent. That’s like being asked to call heads or tails and saying, ‘I call coin.'

name: Stephen Colbert
monologue: Coincidentally, that’s also what it’s called when Don Jr gives Eric a piggyback ride.

name: Stephen Colbert
monologue: Aw yeah! That must have been very exciting news for Donald Trump, because it was the first time he had ever heard of Zimbabwe. ‘Folks, great news! We just got a huge concession from that little truck that cleans the ice at hockey games.

name: Stephen Colbert
monologue: So your theory is we’ll get our factories back but they’ll only have jobs for robots. So you’ll be broke, but at least your Roomba will be able to afford to send its kids to college.

name: Stephen Colbert
monologue: Hello DOGE? Yeah, I’d like to report some government inefficiency.

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: There’s nothing but opportunity as far as the eye can see. It’s a Chernobyl of opportunity right now.

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: Somehow in his brain, Russia’s in a war, but Ukraine isn’t in the same war.

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: China said the tariffs are ‘a mistake on top of a mistake,’ which is also what Trump said when Eric was born.

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: That is true. You know what else no one can ignore? A homeless person swinging a full diaper over his head.

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: I will say, after all that he’s put us through, it’ll be nice to know that on Friday somebody’ll be squeezing his balls for a change.

name: Seth Meyers
monologue: Elon Musk and the Department of Government Efficiency are reportedly working with Boeing to resolve their delays in delivering the new model of Air Force One. Because nothing inspires confidence like hearing, ‘Boeing built this in a hurry.'

name: Seth Meyers
monologue: President Trump on Friday headlined a million-dollars-a-plate fundraising dinner at Mar-a-Lago. Unfortunately, due to the price of groceries, they only broke even.

name: Seth Meyers
monologue: According to new analysis by the Washington Post , President Trump has spent one third of his days in office at gold courses, and I think we might be better off if we can somehow get that up to three thirds.

name: Seth Meyers
monologue: After meeting last week with conspiracy theorist Laura Loomer, President Trump reportedly fired three National Security Council officials… because they can’t be very good at security if this lunatic got that close to the president.

name: Seth Meyers
monologue: Bruce Springsteen announced last week he would release a collection of 83 songs, including 74 of which have never been officially released before. 74 new songs! Did he do one for every factory that closed in New Jersey?

name: Seth Meyers
monologue: By the way, when this collection comes out, give your dad a little space. This is the closest he ever gets to menopause.

name: Seth Meyers
monologue: A Brooklyn technology startup has released a minimalist cell phone that only allows for basic functions like calling, texting, and navigation. I don’t know, is calling really a basic function? I use the compass more than I use calling.

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: Trump wants a full military parade for his birthday. So there will be tanks, fighter jets, and our most dangerous weapon, a self-driving Tesla.

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: It’s nice to know the money we saved cutting the CDC, Social Security, and the Department of Education went towards throwing a child’s birthday party.

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: This was actually supposed to be a surprise party for Trump but someone at the White House added a reporter to the group chat by accident.

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: The parade will be four miles long. The organizers asked Trump if he wanted to walk in it, then everyone laughed and laughed.

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: Trump isn’t messing around with China. Now he’s threatening to not invite them to his birthday party.

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: As a result of the tariffs, Americans are rushing to buy iPhones before prices increase. Yup, iPhones and toilet paper, our two most essential bathroom items.

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: Today the price of a Mega Millions lottery ticket went from $2 to $5. Americans were like, ‘Damn, even losing money got more expensive.'

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: on HHS Secretary Robert F Kennedy Jr’s plan to eliminate fluoride from the nation’s drinking water

name: Taylor Tomlinson
monologue: Now I’m not park ranger, but I’m not sure this is how bear attacks go. Most full grown grizzlies can’t be slowed down by a slight incline.

name: Taylor Tomlinson
monologue: You should see this company’s tornado simulation. They just throw a can at you and yell, ‘Think fast!'

name: Taylor Tomlinson
monologue: That’s like telling me you just got a cool new truck and then rolling up in this: [picture of a Cybertruck].

name: Taylor Tomlinson
monologue: They say on the website the point of their training is for individuals to practice accessing their bear spray as quickly as possible. And I think I speak for every woman in here when I say, ‘Oh, we’re ready.'
